etymology.type: Simplified from 凱 ( 豆 → 己 )
etymology.description: 凱(凱) (kǎi, 'triumphant') originally → 豈(豈) (qǐ, 'drum') + phonetic: 几(几) (jī) = music of triumph -> 豆(豆) ('drum') component simplified to 己(己)
etymology.interpretation: 凯(凱) (kǎi, 'triumphant') originally depicted victory music with a drum element, reinforced with the phonetic component 几(几) (jī). The simplification replaced 豆(豆) (dòu, 'drum') with 己(己), maintaining the balance of sound and meaning.
etymology.simplification: In 凯(凱), 豆(豆) (dòu, 'drum') was replaced with 己(己) to simplify writing while retaining pronunciation and dynamic structure.

examples.chinese: 比赛结束后(比賽結束後)，球队奏响凯歌(球隊奏響凱歌)。
examples.pinyin: Bǐsài jiéshù hòu, qiúduì zòuxiǎng kǎigē.
examples.english: After the game ended, the team sounded their victorious anthem.

examples.chinese: 将军带领部队凯旋出征(將軍帶領部隊凱旋出征)。
examples.english: The general led his troops out on a victorious campaign.

examples.chinese: 经过激战后(經過激戰後)，士兵们凯旋归营(士兵們凱旋歸營)。
examples.pinyin: Jīngguò jīzhàn hòu, shìbīng men kǎixuán guīyíng.
examples.english: After a fierce battle, the soldiers returned to camp in triumph.
